dialogue.line:
No, no, of course I don't have anything planned!
It's only our 698,489,985,382,945th anniversary!

You don't have to get me anything either!
We're keeping it low-key, low-key!!!

Hm... Hum... Ha.... No stars then........
No planets................. Okay.

Yup, yup! It's like that! You really get me, babe!
I absolutely did NOT make you a planet! Hahahahaha!!!
Cosmopolis, Center of the Universe

Thank you for stopping by, Gravobot.
How are your new legs?

That's nice. Is everyone at
the Rho Eta Tau center treating you well?

Good, good! Now, I, uh, must talk to you, Gravobot,
about something, uh, very important...
Something TOP SECRET!!!!!!!

As you know, I married my wife, the SPACE EMPRESS,
698,489,985,382,944 years ago.

As we exchanged vows, the universe was born.
It was a humble ceremony.
As you ALSO know, our anniversary is next month.

We're very busy with you, our precious children,
so we're not giving each other gifts this year.
However.

I love my wife so much, Gravobot. My love for her
is weaved into the fabric of time and space itself.
I made her another planet.

I know! I'm sorry!! I just couldn't help myself!!!
She deserves billions, trillions of planets!!!!!!!!

She deserves a thousand more universes,
each more perfect than the last!!!!!!!!

In any case, I made the planet. I can't undo that.
And I need your help, Gravobot.

I've heard that this planet contains some of the
most beautiful flowers known to botkind.

Apparently, there are so many that
the bots I sent to collect samples weren't enough.

They're swamped with work!! I feel so bad!!!!!
Wah!!!!!!!!!!!

Won't you go help them out, Gravobot?
You're so good with your gravity ball these days!!

If you do this for me, you can have
an extra scoop of light at dinnertime for a decade!

Okay, okay. You drive a hard bargain.
How about this:
I love you very much!
Gravobot agreed to help out at the new planet.
